column4: my windows just got effed up right now (right before me installing ubuntu), I have two 40 gig drives, if I Install ubuntu on one, and then install windows on the other (in that order), will my boot loader work?
I know, but I dont have the windows disk with me
I know...but I dont hav the disc with me, I'm so pissed
But listen
I have windows installed
okay, if I install ubuntu on my other clean drive, and then I 'install, or reinstall' windows on the other, wouldn't the entries be the same? and therefore work?
aww they do
man I'm so pissed, I wont be able to do it until tomorrow then
install linux over the windows, then install windows later. When windows over writes the MBR, use the cd to install GRUB again.
:D, how can I install grub again with the CD
When you boot from the ubuntu cd, type 'expert'
it will give you more options
wouldn't that reinstall ubuntu?
No, you can install grub, then abort the installtion, and reboot. Grub will remain. Just dont install the base system.
is there any other ways to install grub?
any other ways to install grub?
None less complicated. Not unless you know how to make a bootable floppy.
That method  https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows is the best.
